docs.snippet: BERLIN, April 6 -- Eastertide finds Berlin fairly denuded of everything which can be described as society. Parliament has adjourned over the Easter holidays, and everybody of prominence in the political, official, and diplomatic world has gone to the...
docs.lead_paragraph: BERLIN, April 6 -- Eastertide finds Berlin fairly denuded of everything which can be described as society. Parliament has adjourned over the Easter holidays, and everybody of prominence in the political, official, and diplomatic world has gone to the country. The weather over the week-end promises to be crisp but bright, and the Germans, who go in for Easter recreations with particular zest, seem assured of an appropriate atmosphere this year.

headline.main: LEAVE BERLIN FOR EASTER.; Society Taking a Holiday -- American Arrivals and Departures.

byline.original: By Marconi Transatlantic Wireless Telegraph to The New York Times

docs.snippet: There are many new signs of increasing improvement in the business situation, and the uprush to normal conditions seems to be gathering momentum. Although there is still talk of caution, and things are still backward in some sections, the disposition...
docs.lead_paragraph: There are many new signs of increasing improvement in the business situation, and the uprush to normal conditions seems to be gathering momentum. Although there is still talk of caution, and things are still backward in some sections, the disposition to go ahead is becoming contagious, so that something like a trade boom before the Summer is over seems to be among the possibilities.

headline.main: THE STATE OF TRADE; New Signs Appear Showing the Growth of Business Activity and Good Feeling.

docs.snippet: ITHACA, N.Y., May 25. -- Dr. Talcott Williams, head of the new Pulitzer School of Journalism, was the principal speaker at the annual banquet of the Cornell Daily Sun on Tuesday night. His theme was the responsibility of the newspaper profession, and...
docs.lead_paragraph: ITHACA, N.Y., May 25. -- Dr. Talcott Williams, head of the new Pulitzer School of Journalism, was the principal speaker at the annual banquet of the Cornell Daily Sun on Tuesday night. His theme was the responsibility of the newspaper profession, and he dealt particularly with the responsibility of the college newspaper.

headline.main: CORNELL UNIVERSITY.; Dr. Williams, Head of Pulitzer School of Journalism, at Sun Dinner.

docs.snippet: In the demand for steamship tonnage all over the world, which has brought shipping rates to figures never before touched, the South American trade has been near the top in requiring increased accommodations for its products. The trade between Europe...
docs.lead_paragraph: In the demand for steamship tonnage all over the world, which has brought shipping rates to figures never before touched, the South American trade has been near the top in requiring increased accommodations for its products. The trade between Europe and South America has called for more new vessels in the past few years than perhaps any other.

docs.lead_paragraph: Harry L. Reichenbach, an American newspaper and theatrical writer of many years' experience in this city, returned rather hastily to this country on the Lamport Holt steamship Verdi two days ago from Uruguay, after a brief but exciting career there as Press Agent Extraordinary to the People.
docs.abstract: H L Reichenbach, former press agent to people, tells how country is controlled by Blancos party and how it opposed his 'Yankee propaganda' method

headline.main: YANKEE PROPAGANDA UPSETS URUGUAYANS; H.L. Reichenbach, Who Introduced It to Them for Uplift Purposes, Leaves in a Hurry.
